act: The Water (Prevention and Control of Pollution) Act, 1974
title: An Act to provide for the prevention and control of water pollution and the maintaining or restoring of wholesomeness of water
summary: Establishes institutions for the prevention and control of water pollution and for maintaining or restoring water quality.

act: The Water (Prevention and Control of Pollution) Rules, 1975
title: Rules framed under the Water Act to regulate procedures and powers of the Central Pollution Control Board
summary: Provides procedural details for the functioning of the Central Pollution Control Board under the Water Act.

act: The Water (Prevention and Control of Pollution) Cess Act, 1977
title: An Act to provide for the levy and collection of a cess on water consumed by certain industries
summary: Introduced to generate funds to support the boards in controlling water pollution by charging water-consuming industries.

act: The Water (Prevention and Control of Pollution) Cess Rules, 1978
title: Rules for assessment and collection of cess under the Water Cess Act
summary: Defines procedures for calculating and collecting water cess from industries.

act: The Air (Prevention and Control of Pollution) Act, 1981
title: An Act to provide for the prevention, control, and abatement of air pollution
summary: Aims to combat air pollution by setting up Pollution Control Boards and outlining their powers and responsibilities.

act: The Air (Prevention and Control of Pollution) Rules, 1982
title: Rules supporting implementation of the Air Act
summary: Specifies procedural aspects of functioning of boards under the Air Act, including meetings and powers.

title: Power of Central Government to take measures to protect and improve environment
summary: Empowers the Central Government to take all such measures as it deems necessary or expedient for the purpose of protecting and improving the quality of the environment and preventing, controlling and abating environmental pollution.

title: Rules for setting environmental standards under the EPA
summary: Specifies procedures, standards, and safeguards for handling hazardous substances and controlling environmental pollution.

title: Rules for the management, handling, and disposal of hazardous wastes
summary: Provides a regulatory framework for handling hazardous wastes to minimize environmental and health risks.

act: Manufacture, Storage and Import of Hazardous Chemical Rules, 1989
title: Rules to regulate manufacture, storage and import of hazardous chemicals
summary: Ensures safety in manufacture, storage, and import of hazardous chemicals through site notification and safety reports.

title: An Act to provide for the conservation of forests
summary: Restricts and regulates deforestation and diversion of forest land for non-forest purposes without Central Government approval.

title: Rules to regulate forest land diversion procedures
summary: Lays out procedures for obtaining prior approval for use of forest land for non-forest purposes.

title: An Act to provide for the protection and improvement of environment
summary: The Act empowers the Central Government to take necessary measures for protecting and improving the environment and preventing hazards to all living beings.

title: An Act to provide for the protection of wild animals, birds and plants and for matters connected therewith or ancillary or incidental thereto.
summary: Provides the legal framework for the protection of various species of wild animals and plants, management of their habitats, and regulation and control of trade in parts and products derived from them.

title: Rules to regulate transactions in wildlife articles and the practice of taxidermy.
summary: Prescribes rules for licensees dealing in animal articles, trophies, and for taxidermists, including maintenance of records and declaration of stock.
url: (Typically found as an annexure to WLPA compilations or specific state wildlife department resources)

title: Rules for the declaration of stocks of wildlife articles by individuals.
summary: Mandated individuals to declare their stocks of specified wildlife articles to establish a baseline for legally held items.
url: (Typically found as an annexure to WLPA compilations)

act: The Wildlife (Protection) Licensing (Additional Matters for Consideration) Rules, 1983
title: Rules specifying additional factors for consideration when granting wildlife-related licenses.
summary: Outlines extra criteria the licensing authority must consider before granting or renewing licenses under the WLPA, focusing on the applicant's capacity and record, and conservation implications.
url: (Typically found as an annexure to WLPA compilations or state rules)

title: General rules to support the implementation of the Wildlife (Protection) Act, 1972.
summary: Provides various procedural and administrative details for implementing the WLPA, including aspects related to zoos, protected area management, and permit applications.
url: (May be part of central rules or specific state adoptions; often found in WLPA compilations)

act: The Wildlife (Specified Plants - Conditions for Possession by Licensee) Rules, 1995
title: Rules outlining conditions for possession of specified (Schedule VI) plants by licensees.
summary: Regulates how licensees can possess, store, and transport specified endangered plants listed in Schedule VI of the WLPA.
url: (Typically found as an annexure to WLPA compilations)

title: An Act to provide for public liability insurance for the purpose of providing immediate relief to the persons affected by accident occurring while handling any hazardous substance.
summary: Mandates owners handling hazardous substances to take insurance policies to provide immediate no-fault relief to victims of accidents involving such substances.

title: Rules for the implementation of the Public Liability Insurance Act, 1991.
summary: Details the procedures for applying for relief, inquiry by the Collector, insurance policy requirements, and management of the Environmental Relief Fund under PLIA.
url: (Typically found as an annexure to PLIA compilations or Ministry of Environment notifications)

title: An Act to provide for strict liability for damages arising out of any accident occurring while handling any hazardous substance and for the establishment of a National Environment Tribunal.
summary: Aimed to establish a tribunal for strict liability claims from hazardous substance accidents, though largely superseded by the NGT Act, 2010.

act: The National Environment Appellate Authority Act, 1997
title: An Act to provide for the establishment of a National Environment Appellate Authority to hear appeals with respect to restriction of areas in which any industries, operations or processes or class of industries, operations or processes shall not be carried out or shall be carried out subject to certain safeguards under the Environment (Protection) Act, 1986.
summary: Established an appellate authority to hear appeals against orders granting environmental clearances for projects, though its functions were later subsumed by the NGT.
